If you wanted a woman to run as your vice presidential candidate, you could have chosen a well-known, qualified and intelligent Republican woman like Kay Bailey Hutchison from Texas or Olympia Snowe from Maine, but instead you chose a virtually unknown woman from Alaska who believes that:
 [*]Women should not have the right to choose, even when a victim of rape or incest.
 [*]She can remove books from libraries that are in disagreement with her Pentecostal religious beliefs.
 [*]Creationism should be taught in public schools.
 [*]Speaking in tongues qualifies one to be considered bilingual.
 [*]International qualifications for VP include: looking across the Bering Straits and seeing Russia, looking across the border from Kuwait and seeing Iraq and having an aircraft fuel stop in Ireland.
 [*]Giving each Alaskan $1,200 (in addition to the $2,000 they already received) will get you an 80 percent approval rating in Alaska, even though the money is ultimately paid for by oil and gas users in the lower 48 states.
 [*]Pork barrel earmarks are bad when you are running for vice president but good when you are the governor of Alaska, which leads the nation in per-capita pork barrel spending.
 [*]If news conferences are going to reveal your true capability - then by all means read your canned lies and hide from the press.
 [*]Hunting wolves from helicopters demonstrates that you are a true sportsman/woman.
 [*]Global warming is not caused by human behavior.
 Thanks, but no thanks, Sen. McCain. We don't need the "Juneau Hillbillies" living at the Naval Observatory or, God forbid, the White House.
 
 You often repeat a statement about how you always place "country first" before personal gain but your actions belie your words in the case of Palin. She was selected solely for the reason of getting you elected, and she is so completely ill-prepared and ignorant of world politics that her election would put our nation in jeopardy.

 Alaska had aerial hunts before Palin. They were outlawed in 1996 and reinstated in 2000. It's not her new, fresh idea.
 
 Evidently, Alaska needs wolf control on a cyclical basis. Shooting them is much kinder than some other methods I know of.
 
 I suspect that most carcuses are left as food for smaller carnivores. I am not aware of a human driven market for wolf meat. Maybe they are cut up and fed to the Huskies, but I doubt they've become popular on the indoor dinner tables.
 
 Perhaps you could suggest a different method of controlling the wolf population. If it works better, you may get a gold star from PETA...and $1200 or so from the State of Alaska.
 
 I've heard of some other numbnuts wanting to outlaw bow hunting of deer in the southeastern United States. Their claim that many animals are wounded and walk miles before dieing is merely another bleeding heart argument for the prey animal. The culling of animals in some species is required to maintain the health of the rest of the species. Wildlife departments keep track of animal populations and modify limits and seasons as needed. That is why my husband could kill only one black duck per trip while the limit on mallards was quite higher. If you're squimish about the suffering of a wolf that has to be shot more than once (and I noticed your bleeding heart videos did not show the finishing shots) you'd really freak out on watching a duck have his head smashed by the butt of a gun after being brought out of the sky with one pellet.

 When the truth is discovered about how Carter was brought down, his presidency will be pretty respected. There were a lot of dirty shenanigans and sneaky deals made with Iranians over the hostage situation to bring Carter down.

AND, while I'm at it Isly, which of the initial points I made about Sarah do you agree with?
You haven't verified that she holds those views.
 
 Her religious views do not matter to me at all. Her views on abortion do not matter to me at all. She cannot single handedly change any law whatsoever.
 
 "Women should not have the right to choose, even when a victim of rape or incest." 
 
 I don't know that she has said that.
 
 "She can remove books from libraries that are in disagreement with her Pentecostal religious beliefs."
 
 I don't know that she has said that.
 
 "Creationism should be taught in public schools."
 
 I don't know that she has said that. I think classes in religious understanding should be taught, but not necessarily pushed as the truth.
 
 "Speaking in tongues qualifies one to be considered bilingual."
 
 I don't know that she has said that. My silly sister speaks in tongues. I don't hate her for it. I don't recognize it as a language. I think it's about as silly as snake handling.
 
 "International qualifications for VP include: looking across the Bering Straits and seeing Russia, looking across the border from Kuwait and seeing Iraq and having an aircraft fuel stop in Ireland."
 
 I don't know that she has said that. I do know that being governor of any state and mayor of any town, no matter how tiny, entails more responsibility and calls for more use of decision making authority than anything Barack Obama has done in his life to date. I contend that anyone can be a "community organizer". A slick talking liberal like Barack Obama probably makes a really good community organizer. There's no real responsibility attached to that job.
 
 I know that a slick talking liberal can get the backing of other slick talking liberals in order to get a seat in the state senate and to to be pushed into the presidential race prior to maturity. The boy is still wet behind the ears and his cronies have put him in the running.
 
 "Giving each Alaskan $1,200 (in addition to the $2,000 they already received) will get you an 80 percent approval rating in Alaska, even though the money is ultimately paid for by oil and gas users in the lower 48 states." 
 
 What a silly thought. It was Alaskan state income, to be used however seen fit for the benefit of Alaskans. Kuwait does the same on a larger scale, paid for by all the world's users of Kuwaiti oil.
 
 "Pork barrel earmarks are bad when you are running for vice president but good when you are the governor of Alaska, which leads the nation in per-capita pork barrel spending."
 
 I'm not sure she said that. I am sure that she favors reform of excessive goverment spending practices. She did sell the Lear.
 
 The population of Alaska being what it is likely makes the contruction of any infrastructure cost more per capita than in most other states, even though the construction cost may be the same in all states. However, construction costs are relatively high in Alaska, so I doubt your claim really means much.
 
 "If news conferences are going to reveal your true capability - then by all means read your canned lies and hide from the press." 
 
 That may be your impression of the situation. Perhaps you should read the entire transcript of Charlie Gibson's attempt to impale Palin. That presented by ABC was heavily edited to suit their desires.
 
 "Hunting wolves from helicopters demonstrates that you are a true sportsman/woman."
 
 I'm not sure she said that.
 
 "Global warming is not caused by human behavior."
 
 I'm not sure she said that. I'm also not sure how big the human contribution is today. Global warming is a natural thing. We've been coming out of an ice age for thousands of years. No doubt, we are contributing something to it. Just how much is up for debate.
